Parameter.Help: Controlling the relay by means of a single click on the external switch or on the integrated button. TOGGLE: If initial status is ON, then final status is OFF. If initial status is OFF, then final status is ON. ON: If the initial status is OFF the system switches to ON; conversely, it maintains its status (ON). OFF: If the initial status is ON the system switches to OFF; conversely, it maintains its status (OFF).

Parameter.Label: Device Status
Parameter.Help: The final status achieved by the device when it receives a Basic Set command through the Z-Wave network. Available Parameters are; AS RECIEVED: If received command is ON, then final status is ON. If received command is OFF, then final status is OFF. IGNORE IF ON: If received command is ON, then the initial status is maintained. If received command is OFF, then final status is OFF. IGNORE IF OFF: If received command is ON, then final status is ON. If received command is OFF, then the initial status is maintained. IGNORE: The device maintains the initial status.

Parameter.Label: Overcurrent Level
Parameter.Help: Sets the current level above which the time spent above that level is measured. Defined value is divided by 100.

Parameter.Label: Overcurrent Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the time beyond which, in the case of overcurrent at a level higher than that established in parameter 30, an OverCurrent event occurs.

Parameter.Label: Next State
Parameter.Help: Defines the next state of the device if an overcurrent event has occurred. Available Parameters: IGNORE - The device maintains the initial status. ON - If the initial status is OFF the system switches to ON; conversely, it maintains its status (ON). OFF - If the initial status is ON the system switches to OFF: conversely, it maintains its status (OFF). TOGGLE - If the initial status is ON/OFF the system switches to OFF/ON.

Parameter.Label: Meter Reset
Parameter.Help: Provides total operating time from last meter reset. When set to 0 it resets the cumulative values of energy and total operating time.

Item.Label: Meter parameters, including total operating time, will be reset.
Greater than 0 â€“ IGNORE (The meter will not be reset.)

Parameter.Label: Energy flow
Parameter.Help: Determines whether energy events are related to energy consumed or energy produced. Available Parameters are: CONSUMED - Events will be active for Consumed energy flows to which the positive sign will be attributed. PRODUCED - Events will be active for Produced energy flows to which the negative sign will be attributed.

Parameter.Label: UP Power Level
Parameter.Help: Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts beyond which time of permanence above this level is calculated. 0 W - 11250 W Define level of instantaneous power.

Parameter.Label: UP Power Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the time in seconds beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels exceeding threshold defined by parameter 35, a UP Power event occurs. 0 sec - 10800 sec Define time parameter.

Parameter.Label: UP Power State
Parameter.Help: Defines the next status of the device in the case of a UP Power event occurring. Available Parameters: IGNORE - The device maintains the initial status. ON - If the initial status is OFF the system switches to ON; conversely, it maintains its status (ON). OFF - If the initial status is ON the system switches to OFF: conversely, it maintains its status (OFF). TOGGLE - If the initial status is ON/OFF the system switches to OFF/ON.

Parameter.Label: UP Power Associated
Parameter.Help: Sets the level of instantaneous power beyond which the time of permanence below this level is calculated. 0 - Associated devices are switched OFF. -1 - Associated devices are switched ON. 1 - 99 Set parameter for dimming purposes.

Parameter.Label: DOWN Power Level
Parameter.Help: Sets the level of instantaneous power beyond which the time of permanence below this level is calculated. 0 W - 11250 W Define level of instantaneous power.

Parameter.Label: DOWN Power Time
Parameter.Help: SSets the time beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels below threshold defined by parameter 39, a DOWN Power event occurs. 0 sec - 10800 sec. Define time parameter.

Parameter.Label: DOWN Power State
Parameter.Help: Defines the next state of the device in the case of a DOWN Power event occurring. Available Parameters: IGNORE - The device maintains the initial status. ON - If the initial status is OFF the system switches to ON; conversely, it maintains its status (ON). OFF - If the initial status is ON the system switches to OFF: conversely, it maintains its status (OFF). TOGGLE - If the initial status is ON/OFF the system switches to OFF/ON.

Parameter.Label: DOWN Power Associated
Parameter.Help: Defines the status of associated devices in the presence of a DOWN Power event. 0 - Associated devices are switched OFF. -1 - Associated devices are switched ON. 1 - 99 Set parameter for dimming purposes.

Parameter.Label: DOWN Power Associated
Parameter.Help: Sets the energy level that once exceeded an Energy Limit event occurs. Available Range: 0 KWh - 2000000 KWh

Parameter.Label: Energy Limit State
Parameter.Help: Defines the next state of the device in the case of an Energy Limit event occurring. Available Parameters: IGNORE - The device maintains the initial status. ON - If the initial status is OFF the system switches to ON; conversely, it maintains its status (ON). OFF - If the initial status is ON the system switches to OFF: conversely, it maintains its status (OFF). TOGGLE - If the initial status is ON/OFF the system switches to OFF/ON.

Parameter.Label: Variation Instantaneous Power
Parameter.Help: Defines the percentage variation of instantaneous power determining the sending of the report. Available Range: 1 % - 100 %

Parameter.Label: Report Time Frequency
Parameter.Help: Defines the percentage variation of instantaneous power determining the sending of the report. Available Range: 1 min - 100 mins

Parameter.Label: Variation Total Energy
Parameter.Help: Defines the increase of total energy required to generate a report listing the level of total energy to the devices associated to the Energy Notification Group.

Parameter.Label: Nominal Voltage
Parameter.Help: Defines the nominal voltage value in tenths of volts. Together with parameter No. 49 this is used by the automatic notification system to send reports on variations of voltage. Available Range: 1100 v - 2500 v

Parameter.Label: Fall In Maximum Voltage
Parameter.Help: Defines, as a percentage, the nominal value for permitted fall in maximum voltage. Available Range: 1 - 100%

Parameter.Label: Electric parameters subjected to automatic notification
Parameter.Help: Defines which electric parameters, other than power, will be subjected to automatic notification. The value to be set for this parameter must be calculated as the sum of values associated to the individual electric parameter: Power=0, Energy=2, Voltage=4, Current=8, Power factor=16, Multilevel Sensor: Power Report=32 To send report only for Power please set the value to 0. By default the report are sent for (Power, Energy, Voltage, Current, Power Factor) 0+2+4+8+16=30

Parameter.Label: Voltage RMS value
Parameter.Help: Reading of this parameter returns the value of voltage RMS at the time of the reading expressed in tenths of Volts.

Parameter.Label: Current RMS value
Parameter.Help: Returns the value of current RMS expressed in hundredths of Amperes.

Parameter.Label: Power Factor
Parameter.Help: Returns the value of power factor as a percentage

Parameter.Label: Total energy consumed
Parameter.Help: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

Parameter.Label: Total energy produced
Parameter.Help: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

Parameter.Label: Start-up status
Parameter.Help: Defines the status of the device following a restart.

Item.Label: PREVIOUS STATUS: Status prior to restart

Parameter.Label: Configuration reset
Parameter.Help: Defines which parameters should be reset to default values.

Item.Label: FACTORY RESET: The device is reset to the original factory settings.
ASSOCIATIONS RESET: All associations and only the associations are reset.
CONFIGURATIONS RESET: The associations are maintained while all other configuration parameters are reset to the original factory settings, except for the specific configuration.

Parameter.Label: Type of external switch
Parameter.Help: Defines the type of external switch connected to the device.

Item.Label: IGNORE: The external switch is not connected or not present.
BUTTON: The external switch is a normally open button.
SWITCH: The external switch is a traditional switch.

Parameter.Label: Load Control
Parameter.Help: Defines the load control mode. Available Parameters are: 1 - DIRECT CONTROL The external load is controlled directly by the relay. Reference diagram local load control. 2 - The external load is controlled by a contactor that in a resting state has open contacts (load control by means of external contactor). 3 - The external load is controlled by a contactor that in a resting state has closed contacts (load control by means of external contactor). 4 - The relay is only used to control the ignition of an external warning light, as, for example, in the case of notification of excess loads and surges (remote load control).

Item.Label: CONTROL BY MEANS OF A CONTACTOR WITH NORMALLY OPEN COMMAND:
CONTROL BY MEANS OF A CONTACTOR WITH NORMALLY CLOSED COMMAND:
